title: Belgian Endive with Thyme
summary: Belgian Endive with Thyme might be just the side dish you are searching for. For 23 cents per serving, this recipe covers 1% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 4. Watching your figure? This caveman, gluten free, primal, and whole 30 recipe has 126 calories, 0g of protein, and 14g of fat per serving. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. Head to the store and pick up thyme, shallot, olive oil, and a few other things to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 1 hour. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 15%. This score is rather bad. Try Bay Shrimp on Belgian Endive, Belgian Endive and Ham Casserole, and Belgian Endive Ham Au Gratin for similar recipes.
instructions: Instructions                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Heat the oil in a large deep frying pan over medium heat. Add the endives, shallot, thyme, and bay leaf. Cook, turning the endives occasionally, for about 3 minutes, until they are golden all over.                                                     Add 2 tbsp water and reduce the heat to low. Cover the pan and simmer for 2025 minutes, or until the endives are tender when pierced with a knife. Season with salt and pepper, then serve with the pan juices spooned over.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                var articleType_27_data = {};                    articleType_27_data.init_step_by_step_images = 0;

steps.step: Heat the oil in a large deep frying pan over medium heat.
Add the endives, shallot, thyme, and bay leaf. Cook, turning the endives occasionally, for about 3 minutes, until they are golden all over.

Add 2 tbsp water and reduce the heat to low. Cover the pan and simmer for 2025 minutes, or until the endives are tender when pierced with a knife. Season with salt and pepper, then serve with the pan juices spooned over.
